column4: i cannot access File -> Change Device menu nor the volume control ... since i upgraded to 8.04... any ideas?
i have a usb-flash disk (NTFS) that i have mounted, but all its files are locked, and i need to delete some .exe files which are viruses
why not run them through clamav
well, it seems 8.04 hasnt yet supported some NTFS drives... clamav works on 8.04?
sure it does
automatically? well, it DID mount the flash, but i dont have read/write access
check out my pastebin http://pastebin.ca/1018804
i followed instructions at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MountingWindowsPartitions but they didnt work
I'd suggest going with clamav then
clamav will clean the viruses even with my current access rights?
not sure about that? why not copy over the good files and then format
hi... do u know why VLC doesnt support SVCD media on 9.04? and how do i make it recognise my SVCD disc?
not sure; should work-->you tried playing it on dvd player yet
dont have any dvds here with me... i sent my demos to the broadcasting corp. am gonna be working with, starting monday... lolz
i even tried the SVCD discs on my iMac... didnt play... they only play on a commercial home theatre system
sounds like they have some weird anti-computer drm on them then
what's drm?
digital restriction s management
ah...
but the SVCD is my own... i created it using Adobe Premiere Pro 1.5 (Windows) way back in 2006!
really no idea apart from asking you to try some different players
